introduction.paragraph: When an applicaiton deletes a document a tombstone revison is created, over time the number tombstones can become significant. Tombstones allow document deletions to be propogated to other clients via replication. For some applications the replication of a tombstone may not be useful after period of time. The purge command provides a way to remove the tombstones from a Sync Gateway database, recovering storage space and reducing the amount of data replicated to clients.

body.paragraph: This request does not use headers.
This request does not use query parameters.
The message body is a JSON document that contains the following objects:

row.entry: List containing the revisions to purge for the given docID, currently the list must contain the single value "*", meaning all revisons.

unordered-list.list-item: 200 OK – The resync operation was successful
400 Bad Request – _purge document ID's must be passed as a JSON
404 Not Found – The specified database does not exist

body.paragraph: This response uses only standard HTTP headers.
The response message body is a JSON document that contains one entry for each docID successfully purged.

row.entry: Contains one property for each document ID successfully purged, the property key is the "docID" and the property value is a list containing the single entry "*".
